Sentencas: This work details efforts to estimate the direct manufacturing cost of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stack components for combined heat and power applications.
Titulo: A Direct Manufacturing Cost Model for Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell Stacks

Sentencas: The main research goals are to identify the major contributors to fuel cell stack manufacturing costs, examine the influence of both production volume and stack size on cost, and compare the results of the cost trajectories with the U.S. Department of Energy SOFC stack manufacturing cost target of $238 kWe(-1) (in 2015) and industry reported cost projections and to identify critical areas for manufacturing research and development.
Titulo: A Direct Manufacturing Cost Model for Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell Stacks

Sentencas: Stack component direct manufacturing costs are modeled for net electricity capacity of 1, 10, 50, 100 and 250 kWe across annual production volumes of 10, 1,000, 10,000 and 50,000 systems per year.
Titulo: A Direct Manufacturing Cost Model for Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell Stacks

Sentencas: Overall stack manufacturing costs range from $5,387 kWe(-1) to a minimum of about $166 kWe(-1) for a 250 kWe system at 50,000 systems per year.
Titulo: A Direct Manufacturing Cost Model for Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell Stacks

Sentencas: To meet the manufacturing cost target of $238 kWe(-1), a minimum annual production of 100-250 MWe per year would be required.
Titulo: A Direct Manufacturing Cost Model for Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell Stacks

Sentencas: Reduction opportunities for stack cost are expected to be available, mainly with the adoption of thinner cells and stack components, higher levels of factory automation, and more sensitive in-line defect diagnostics.
Titulo: A Direct Manufacturing Cost Model for Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell Stacks
